summary: An ordinance ratifying and confirming a loan of the City of Seattle, in the aggregate sum of Three Hundred Thousand Dollars ($300,000) for the purpose of providing funds for making certain additions to the existing Cedar River Water Supply System, of said city, authorized at an election held March 4, 1913, under and pursuant to Ordinance No. 30715, and directing the issuance of such bonds in the sum of Three Hundred Thousand Dollars ($300,000) and the levy and collection of taxes for the payment of the principal and interest thereof.
